content: the fall feels are here…crisp air-breathing pumpkin spice latte- drinking chunky wool handknit-wearing days we knitters can t wait for these cooler days and nights with all the knitting inspiration they bring to celebrate fall i ve added my own tinker creek handknits knitting pattern to the website… featuring knit pumpkins because i m obsessed with them they re made from cascade 220 superwash yarn in the colorway pumpkin 822 i used all natural materials to stuff them cotton and/or wool and decorate them cinnamon sticks work great for the stem of the pumpkin i tucked in wild berries and fall flowers around the stem from this pattern you can create so many variations … for example add or subtract rounds to make them taller or smaller adjust the stuffing to make them plumper if you like tie a ribbon around the stem it s up to you sizes small medium and large i used double pointed needles in size 6 4 mm pattern skills cast on working in the round increases decreases knit and purl
